StockManager.SimpleDatabase

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • StockManager.SimpleDatabase.DBManager

  • class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for interfacing with the SQLite database. This is an internal class that you don't need to worry about. Unless you are working on this project, in which case, you probably need to worry about it.
    Since:
    31/08/2015

    • Method Detail

      • SetDBLocation

        public static void SetDBLocation(java.lang.String new_path,
                                 java.lang.String new_name)
        Changes the location and name of the database file. If you are going to change the database from the default database/database.db, make sure that you call this function when you initialise your program, before you attempt to perform any operations on the database.
        Parameters:
        new_path - - the path where the database file will be located, without the trailing '/'
        new_name - - the name of the database file

      • Execute

        public static void Execute(java.lang.String query)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query. No safety checks whatsoever are conducted on the query string. Use with caution!
        Parameters:
        query - - the query to execute
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - this static class handles no exceptions.

      • ExecuteReturnKey

        public static int ExecuteReturnKey(java.lang.String query)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the SQL and return the key of the affected row Obviously .. the query can only be one INSERT only.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        Returns:
        the pri key of the newly created row
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - this class does not handle faulty queries

      • ExecuteQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet ExecuteQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                              java.sql.Connection connection)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a query and returns the results in a resultSet These queries are executed in three stages connect -> executeQuery -> disconnect
        Parameters:
        query - The SELECT query to execute
        connection - The object that represents a connection to the database. It is returned by DBManager.Connect()
        Returns:
        The results of the query, stored in a java.sql.ResultSet object.
        Throws:
        SQLException, - because this class does not handle exceptions at all.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • Connect

        public static java.sql.Connection Connect()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to the database, and returns a connection object that can be used to process SQL and so forth.
        Returns:
        A connection object that is connected to the database. Remember to close when finished!
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - SQL Exceptions aren't handled by this class.

      • Disconnect

        public static void Disconnect(java.sql.Connection connection)
        Disconnects the given connection from the database.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to disconnect

      • Disconnect

        public static void Disconnect(java.sql.ResultSet results)
        Disconnect the ResultSet from the database.
        Parameters:
        results - The ResultSet to disconnect.

      • closeQuietly

        private static void closeQuietly(java.sql.ResultSet res)
        Sssh! Utility functions to close database connections without a fuss.
        Parameters:
        res - - the database entity to close

      • closeQuietly

        private static void closeQuietly(java.sql.Connection res)
